meanings.definition: a disorder in which an organ or tissue of the body wastes away
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the dystrophies in his lungs were causing breathing problems.
meanings.sent2: Muscular dystrophies can lead to weakness and loss of muscle mass over time.
meanings.sent3: The dystrophies in the garden made the plants look wilted and sad.
meanings.sent4: The dystrophies in the old building were evident in its crumbling walls and peeling paint.
meanings.sent5: The dystrophies in the tree's branches made it look like it was slowly withering away.

meanings.sent4: Over time, the dystrophies in the muscle tissue can lead to mobility issues.
meanings.sent5: The dystrophies in the weightlifter's muscles were visible after years of intense training.

meanings.definition: a condition characterized by abnormal development or growth
meanings.sent1: The plant's dystrophies resulted in stunted growth and wilting leaves.
meanings.sent2: Genetic dystrophies can affect a person's physical appearance.
meanings.sent3: The dystrophies in the cake batter caused it to rise unevenly in the oven.
meanings.sent4: Emotional dystrophies can impact a person's mental well-being.
meanings.sent5: The dystrophies in the child's cognitive development required specialized intervention.
